articles.author: Idrees Ali, Humeyra Pamuk, John Irish
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump has promised a swift end to the Ukraine war but with talks about to begin the author of "The Art of the Deal" may have already complicated his task by sacrificing leverage.
articles.title: Trump says he backs Ukraine, but early concessions to Russia spark concerns

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A car drove into a crowd in Munich on Thursday injuring several people, police said, as the southern German city prepares for a top-level security conference due to be attended by U.S. Vice President JD Vance and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.
articles.title: Several injured after car drives into crowd of people in Munich

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Palestinian militant group Hamas said on Thursday it did not want the Gaza ceasefire agreement to collapse.
articles.title: Hamas says it does not want Gaza ceasefire to collapse

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese officials in recent weeks have floated a proposal to hold a summit between Russian President Vladimir Putin and U.S. President Donald Trump as part of peacekeeping efforts to end the Ukraine war, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday citing people familiar with the matter.
articles.title: China pushes for peacekeeping efforts to end Ukraine war, WSJ reports

articles.author: Andrew Gray, Lili Bayer, John Irish
articles.description: European leaders scrambled on Thursday to try to get a seat at the table in Ukraine peace talks after U.S. President Donald Trump spoke directly to Russian President Vladimir Putin and announced the start of negotiations.
articles.title: Europeans seek Ukraine talks role after Trump calls Putin

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine and Europe should not be excluded from future peace talks on the Ukraine war, Kyiv's Foreign Minister Andrii Sybiha told Le Monde newspaper in an interview released on Thursday.
articles.title: Talks on Ukraine must include Kyiv, Ukrainian foreign minister says

articles.author: Timour Azhari
articles.description: Syria's new rulers are combing through the billion-dollar corporate empires of ousted president Bashar al-Assad's allies, and have held talks with some of these tycoons, in what they say is a campaign to root out corruption and illegal activity.
articles.title: Exclusive: Syria's new leaders zero in on Assad's business barons

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, David Brunnstrom
articles.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will come bearing gifts when he meets Donald Trump, hoping concessions on tariffs, fresh business deals and the prospect of cooperation on China will win the US president's favor.
articles.title: India's Modi brings a tariff 'gift' to Trump talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. intelligence warns that Israel is likely to launch a preemptive attack on Iran's nuclear program by midyear, the Washington Post reported on Wednesday, citing multiple intelligence reports.
articles.title: Israel seen as likely to attack Iran by midyear, Washington Post reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Elon Musk will face consequences for meddling in Germany's election campaign, Friedrich Merz, the frontrunner to become the country's next chancellor, said in an interview with the Wall Street Journal published on Thursday.
articles.title: Musk will face consequences for meddling in German politics, election frontrunner warns
